name: Handstand
description: A handstand is an inverted position where you balance on your hands with your body fully extended upwards. It's typically performed by kicking up into the position or pressing up from a bent-arm position.

name: Planche
description: The planche is a challenging skill where you hold your body parallel to the ground, supported only by your hands. Your arms are straight, and your body is kept in a horizontal line from head to toes.
progressions: Rings Straight-Arm Straddle Planche to Handstand

name: Dragon Squat
description: A dragon squat, or dragon pistol squat, involves performing a single-leg squat while the other leg is extended behind and around the squatting leg. It requires significant balance, strength, and flexibility.

name: Backlever
description: In a back lever, you hang from a bar or rings and rotate your body backward, keeping it straight and parallel to the ground. This position is held by tensing your core, back, and shoulder muscles.
